Problems we solve...

How can you get objective insights into the audience mind ?

How to predict media audimate and income?

Realisation

How to realise interactive experiences?



Our solutions

Physiological data analytics and visualisation for audiovisual media.

Biosensing

Measure brain activity, heart beats and skin conductance to know when low arousal and some emotions happen.

Eye tracking

Track eye movements to know where the audience is focusing attention.

Data science

Detect patterns of activity to predict the audience will like the media.

Virtual reality

Develop immersive and interactive contents from data analytics with partners.

About

Let's talk about our story...

  • March 2016

    Our Idea have Grown

    We start measuring our eye movements and heart beats while watching famous movies (the hateful eight, the revenant or the shining). Very quickly, we were exploring how theses movies would impact our brain waves, we found it amayzing and beginned the project.

  • May 2016

    INRIA Approved Our Project

    We are hosted at the INRIA research center of Sophia-Antipolis which provides research and business expertise to transform our project into an innovative startup.

  • Be Part
    Of Our
    Story!

Gaze tracking and face analysis

This is an example of gaze analysis combined with face recognition for measuring faces of interviewed people capture attention of spectators. The dataset was obtained from the DIEM database including 32 participants watching a video of people interviewed in brooklyn.

  • Client: The DIEM Project
  • Date: April 2014
  • Service: Distribution

Heatmap for movie trailers

This is an example of a gaze map (or heatmap) for measuring where viewers pay attention. The dataset was obtained from the DIEM database including 32 participants watching the tailer of Harry Potter 6. Hot spots correspond to high density of viewers gaze.

  • Client: The DIEM Project
  • Date: April 2014
  • Service: Distribution
